channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-14180] FileSystem contract tests to replace JUnit 3 with 4
item.description:
This is from discussion in HADOOP-14170, as Steve commented:

...it's time to move this to JUnit 4, annotate all tests with @test, and make the test cases skip if they don't have the test FS defined. JUnit 3 doesn't support Assume, so when I do test runs without the s3n or s3 fs specced, I get lots of errors I just ignore.
...Move to Junit 4, and, in our own code, find everywhere we've subclassed a method to make the test a no-op, and insert an Assume.assumeTrue(false) in there so they skip properly.
item.summary: FileSystem contract tests to replace JUnit 3 with 4

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
To make this task clear, we need to:

  1. Make FileSystemContractBaseTest not extend TestCase class
  2. Annotate all the test methods in FileSystemContractBaseTest and all its subclasses (~13) @Test
  3. Add default timeout / exception Rules in the base class
  4. There are a few places that uses if (!renameSupported()) return; to skip FS that does not support rename. Let's use assumeTrue(renameSupported() instead. This will be reflected in test report, not just passing.
  5. There are a few places that uses if (!rootDirTestEnabled() return;. Let's assume as well.
  6. Update javadoc if necessary

stevel@apache.org please add more if I missed something.
Looks good to me. Have it extend Assert instead.
I posted v0 patch for reviews, thx.

-1 overall

OK, this looks good, but the Azure tests are NPE-ing.

I suspect we'd have problems with the swift & s3 ones, but as they aren't being run by Yetus, we aren't catching those. Whatever fixes Azure is what we (I?) will have to apply there.

Do you know why the Azure tests are failing? If we can address that then I'll apply this patch locally and deal with the other blobstores

stevel@apache.org Thanks for reviewing this. For the NPE failing tests, I found the root cause is that, the tests should not run if fs and/or testAccount is not initialized. This behavior was previously controlled by overriding the runTest() method, like:

59	  @Override		
60	  protected void runTest() throws Throwable {		
61	    if (testAccount != null) {		
62	      super.runTest();		
63	    }		
64	  }

But w/ the v0 patch, we deleted this check. A simple fix is to call assumeNotNull(fs) in the @Before setUp() method of each subclass where fs may be not initialized per config, e.g. TestNativeAzureFileSystemContractPageBlobLive, TestNativeAzureFileSystemContractEmulator, and TestNativeAzureFileSystemContractLive. I updated this in the v1 patch.

Meanwhile, the v0 patch misses the TestAliyunOSSFileSystemContract and v1 patch also fixes it.

-1 overall

Thanks xiaobingo and liuml07. The patch mostly looks good to me. Two comments:
1. Would you add @Test to testDeleteSubdir, testGetFileStatusFileAndDirectory, and testMkdirsForExistingFile in TestAliyunFileSystemContract.java?
2. Would you replace AssertionFailedError with AssertionError in TestSwiftFileSystemContract.java? org.junit.Assert does not throw junit.framework.AssertionFailedError.
Since HADOOP-14415 was fixed, the above second comment is no longer valid. I'm +1 if the first comment is addressed.

Thanks ajisakaa.

xiaobingo, would you post a new patch to address these comments and failing tests?
Posted v2 patch, thanks stevel@apache.org ajisakaa and liuml07 for reviews.

Thanks xiaobingo for updating the patch! I found an additional minor issue.

FileSystemContractBaseTest.java
 * To test a given {@link FileSystem} implementation create a subclass of this
 * test and override {@link #setUp()} to initialize the <code>fs</code> 
 * {@link FileSystem} instance variable.

The sentence is no longer valid. Would you replace "override #setup()" with "add a @Before method"?
Posted v3 to fix it, thanks ajisakaa
